PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_MaterialFuel
PropertySetDef.Definition: A set of extended material properties of fuel energy typically used within the context of building services and flow distribution systems.

PropertyDef.Name: CombustionTemperature
PropertyDef.Definition:
Combustion temperature.
Combustion temperature of the material when air is at 298 K and 100 kPa.

PropertyDef.Name: CarbonContent
PropertyDef.Definition: The carbon content in the fuel. This is measured in weight of carbon per unit weight of fuel and is therefore unitless.

PropertyDef.Name: LowerHeatingValue
PropertyDef.Definition: Lower Heating Value is defined as the amount of energy released (MJ/kg) when a fuel is burned completely, and H2O is in vapor form in the combustion products.

PropertyDef.Name: HigherHeatingValue
PropertyDef.Definition: Higher Heating Value is defined as the amount of energy released (MJ/kg) when a fuel is burned completely, and H2O is in liquid form in the combustion products.
